intro: Galium munzii f. glabrum, commonly known as the smooth bedstraw, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its prostrate growth habit and small, opposite leaves. The plant produces clusters of white or pale yellow flowers in the summer, which are arranged in umbels. It thrives in dry, open habitats such as gravelly slopes and rocky areas. Its smooth, hairless stems and foliage distinguish it from other members of the Galium genus.
